title: 【屌柒TVB特別任】投訴機場特警 種族歧視！ (1 Apr)

replies.msg:
【屌柒TVB特別任務1 Apr 2020】


✉️ Email 投訴TVB種族歧視 ✉️

柒台TVB 唔止針對香港人岀假新聞，依家連少數族裔都唔放過！😡

TVB出咗名封建，劇集不時出現恐同、恐愛滋、貶低少數族裔情節📺
今次《機場特警》故意安排南亞裔人士演犯通緝犯。
演員張振朗更說到：「你中文講得咁快嘅？」貶低香港南亞人士既廣東話能力。😡

👇🏼投訴信Template👇🏼

To: webmaster@ofca.gov.hk, complaint@eoc.org.hk
Title: 有關電視廣播有限公司劇集《機場特警》內容涉及違反種族歧視條例

通訊事務管理局辦公室總監、平等機會委員會主席鈞鑒：

本人在2020年3月30日（一）觀看電視廣播有限公司（TVB）旗下電視台81台翡翠台於晚上八時三十分播出的電視劇《機場特警》時，發現其內容涉及違反種族歧視條例，因此作出投訴。

《機場特警》中的其中一幕中，指機場有2名南亞裔通緝犯打劫機場找換店，逐後機場特警作出拘捕行動，期間演員張振朗更說到：「你中文講得咁快嘅？」

本人認為此段內容與香港現時實況有嚴重差距，特意安排南亞裔人士飾演罪犯亦有歧視之意，嚴重影響劇集內容描繪性及可信度，本入的投訴理據如下：

（一）首先，根據「2018年香港罪案情況記者會」中的數據，香港在2018年中錄得的整體罪案數字是54225宗，而同年的非華裔被捕人士有2021人，當中1150人持Form 8行街紙，比2017年下跌2.5%，犯罪比例僅佔整體罪案數字的7.4%，未到一成，而非華裔被捕人士亦並非只包括南亞裔人士，可見南亞裔人士的犯罪比率實在不高。

根據香港《種族歧視條例》，「種族中傷」是指基於某人的種族或屬某類別人士的成員的種族，藉公開活動煽動其他人對該人的或屬該類別人士的成員的仇恨、嚴重鄙視或強烈嘲諷。《機場特警》編劇刻意安排南亞裔人士為罪犯，令人有歧視及標籤南亞裔人士的感覺。

（二）根據《2016年中期人口統計主題性報告：少數族裔人士》，本港少數族裔人士在家交談使用廣東話者達30.3%，而普通話則只有1.3%，另外接近一半（48.6%）的少數族裔人士均能說廣州話。任職香港電台的利君雅便是一個好例子，作為南亞裔的她能操一口流行的廣州話，她亦曾在電視廣播有限公司任職新聞主播，相信電視廣播有限公司的員工理應知道少數族裔人士能說廣州話這個事實。

在《種族歧視條例》中，「種族騷擾」是指基於某人的種族或其近親的種族，而作出不受歡迎的行徑（可包括口頭或書面陳述），令該人因該行徑而感到受冒犯、侮辱或威嚇，或作出某行徑，造成對該人有敵意或具威脅性的環境。我認為張振朗所說的對白：「你中文講得咁快嘅？」對少數族裔人士有冒犯之意，違反種族歧視條例。

香港是一個多元文化的國際大都會，根據《2016年中期人口統計》的數據中顯示，於香港居住的少數族裔人士數目達584 383人，佔全港人口的8.0%，當中不少人亦是土生土長的香港人。香港政府多來年一直致力於種族共融之工作，2017年立法會議員張超雄曾在立法會上提出不應對南亞裔人士的案件過份渲染:「好似講親南亞裔人士就同罪案有關，咁係唔公道，亦影響少數族裔融入社會嘅機會。」

電視廣播有限公司作為全港市場佔有率最大之電視廣播公司，絕對有責任推動共融工作，而不是帶頭歧視少數族裔人士、標籤他們為罪犯、錯誤引導市民少數族裔不諳粵語，深化少數族裔人士在融入社會時遇到的困難，希望部門能夠正視問題。


市民＿＿＿敬啟

而家試下

replies.msg:
To whom it may concern,

On 30th March 2020, the content of the show ‘Airport Strikers’ aired on TVB channel 81 at 8.30pm was suspected to violate Race Discrimintation Ordinance(RDO). Such blatant racism is unacceptable in a metropolis like Hong Kong, so I am writing to articulate my sentiments and complaint.

Please refer to the link below for content inspection. During a scene from Airport Strikers, two South Asian actors acted as robbers targeting at airport money exchangers and later got arrested by the Airport Security Unit. The actor Owen Cheung, starring as one of the ASU, has a line that goes like this:“How come you speak Canto so fluently?”「你中文講得咁快嘅？」The line is totally irrelevant to the plot and show little understanding of the South Asian residents in Hong Kong.

As we all know, the scene hardly matches Hong Kong situation nowadays and such huge discrepancy could fuel racial discrimination and hurt citizens feelings. Details are as follows:

1. According to ‘2018 Law and Order Situation Press Conference’, out of the 54225 cases in 2018, only 2021 were committed by non-chinese. Out of the 2021 non-Chinese criminals, it is logical that not all are South Asians; and 1150 out of them held Recognizance Form No.8, resulting in a decrease of 2.5% compared to 2017 figures, constituting just 7.4% of overall crimes committed. The low number reveals that crime rate of South Asians are not high at all.

According to the RDO, any act that incites, by any activity in public, hatred towards, serious contempt for, or severe ridicule of a person on the ground of the race of that person, is an unlawful act of racial vilification. The script of Airport Strikers deliberately had South Asians portrayed as criminals, that is an act of deplorable disrespect and discrimination.

2. According to the 2016 Population By-Census report on Ethnic Minorities in Hong Kong, among ethnic minorities aged 5 and over, Cantonese was the second most spoken language at home, with a large proportion of 30.3%; and near half (48.6%) of ethnic minorities could speak Cantonese. Nabela Qoser利君雅 who work for RTHK and speaks very fluent Cantonese would be a good example. As she also worked for TVB before as a newscaster, it is believed that the corporation well understood that most of ethnic minorities could speak Canto.

quote.msg: 冇呀，有冇志意軍翻譯？
而家試下

To whom it may concern,

On 30th March 2020, the content of the show ‘Airport Strikers’ aired on TVB channel 81 at 8.30pm was suspected to violate Race Discrimintation Ordinance(RDO). Such blatant racism is unacceptable in a metropolis like Hong Kong, so I am writing to articulate my sentiments and complaint.

Please refer to the link below for content inspection. During a scene from Airport Strikers, two South Asian actors acted as robbers targeting at airport money exchangers and later got arrested by the Airport Security Unit. The actor Owen Cheung, starring as one of the ASU, has a line that goes like this:“How come you speak Canto so fluently?”「你中文講得咁快嘅？」The line is totally irrelevant to the plot and show little understanding of the South Asian residents in Hong Kong.

As we all know, the scene hardly matches Hong Kong situation nowadays and such huge discrepancy could fuel racial discrimination and hurt citizens feelings. Details are as follows:

1. According to ‘2018 Law and Order Situation Press Conference’, out of the 54225 cases in 2018, only 2021 were committed by non-chinese. Out of the 2021 non-Chinese criminals, it is logical that not all are South Asians; and 1150 out of them held Recognizance Form No.8, resulting in a decrease of 2.5% compared to 2017 figures, constituting just 7.4% of overall crimes committed. The low number reveals that crime rate of South Asians are not high at all.

According to the RDO, any act that incites, by any activity in public, hatred towards, serious contempt for, or severe ridicule of a person on the ground of the race of that person, is an unlawful act of racial vilification. The script of Airport Strikers deliberately had South Asians portrayed as criminals, that is an act of deplorable disrespect and discrimination.

2. According to the 2016 Population By-Census report on Ethnic Minorities in Hong Kong, among ethnic minorities aged 5 and over, Cantonese was the second most spoken language at home, with a large proportion of 30.3%; and near half (48.6%) of ethnic minorities could speak Cantonese. Nabela Qoser利君雅 who work for RTHK and speaks very fluent Cantonese would be a good example. As she also worked for TVB before as a newscaster, it is believed that the corporation well understood that most of ethnic minorities could speak Canto.

replies.msg:
With reference to RDO, Racial harassment can be in any form—physical, visual, verbal or non-verbal—and even a single incident may constitute racial harassment. Racial harassment is any unwelcome conduct towards another person on the ground of his or her race. The line by Owen Cheung「你中文講得咁快嘅？」was perceived as insulting and humiliating to ethnic minorities and thus infringed the RDO.

Hong Kong is an international city with multifarious cultures. According to the 2016 Population By-Census report on Ethnic Minorities in Hong Kong, there are 584 383 of them living here, about 8.0% of Hong Kong population. Many of them are born and raised here, a non-separable part of our community. The government has been promoting social inclusion for years, even legislators like Fernando Cheung had raised concerns over the exaggeration of crimes committed by South Asians in 2017. Just as he said, ‘It seems like whenever people talk about South Asians, they think about their crimes and misconduct. This is unfair, and definitely lowers their chance of being accepted by the society.’

With the greatest shares of the HK broadcasting industry, TVB has the corporate responsibility to promote social communion, instead of encouraging irrational prejudice against ethnic minorities, labelling them as criminals and presenting stereotyes like they cannot speak Cantonese.

TVB’s ignorance and the utter prejudice against ethnic minorities are intolerable and shall be addressed as soon as possible. Would your department please handle the situation fairly and quickly. Thank you for your attention and I look forward to your concrete actions.

Yours faithfully,
xxx
